reason: Move to the pear first, as it is positioned close to the target apple and may block the grasping path if not cleared.
Lower the arm to the working height to prepare for pushing or pulling the pear away from the target.
Pull the pear toward the robot base to create more space around the target apple for grasping.
The pear needs further repositioning; push it to create additional clearance around the target apple.
Continue pushing the pear to ensure it is sufficiently far from the target apple before attempting to grasp.
Lift the arm to a safe height after clearing the pear, preparing to approach the target for grasping.
Reset the hand to the default open posture to ensure proper finger configuration before grasping the apple.
The pear has been cleared from the workspace. Attempt to grasp the target apple now.
Lift the arm to verify the grasp was successful and confirm the apple has been picked up.
The target (apple) has been successfully grasped. The task is complete.
